manage.title: Manage Campaigns
manage.subtitle: Pause, resume, and monitor your campaigns, ad sets, and ads
manage.invalid_budget: Please enter a valid budget amount
manage.hierarchy_guide: Campaign → Ad Set → Ad. Click the arrow to expand. If a campaign or ad set is paused, all items inside it won't run even if they show as active.

metrics.spend_tooltip: Total money spent on your ads during this period
metrics.impressions_tooltip: How many times your ads were displayed to people
metrics.clicks_tooltip: Number of times people clicked on your ads
metrics.ctr_tooltip: Percentage of people who clicked after seeing your ad. Higher = more engaging
metrics.cpc_tooltip: Average cost for each click on your ad. Lower = more efficient
metrics.conversions_tooltip: Actions you care about: purchases, signups, or leads
metrics.conversion_value_tooltip: Total revenue generated from your conversions
metrics.roas_tooltip: Return on Ad Spend: Revenue earned per $1 spent. Higher = more profitable
metrics.cpa_tooltip: Average cost for each conversion. Lower = better efficiency
metrics.conversion_rate_tooltip: Percentage of clicks that became conversions. Higher = better targeting

creatives.hold_rate_tooltip: Percentage of viewers who kept watching. Shows if content holds interest
creatives.avg_watch_time_tooltip: Average time viewers spend watching your video
creatives.avg_completion_tooltip: Percentage of video watched on average
creatives.fatigue_tooltip: How tired your audience is of seeing this ad. High fatigue = declining performance

learning.title: Beginner Guide
learning.subtitle: Everything you need to succeed with Facebook Ads
learning.ads_structure_desc: Understanding Campaign, Ad Set, and Ad
learning.campaign_definition: The container that holds your objective (Sales, Leads, Traffic) and budget strategy
learning.adset_definition: The targeting settings - who sees your ads, when, and where
learning.ad_definition: The creative - what people actually see (image/video + text)
learning.ads_per_adset: 3-5 ads per ad set is recommended. This lets Facebook optimize delivery without diluting your budget.
learning.new_campaign_vs_adset: Create a new campaign for different objectives (Sales vs Leads). Create a new ad set for different audiences (US vs UK, or different ages).
learning.budget_testing: Start with $5-20/day per ad set for testing
learning.budget_scaling: When scaling, increase budget by 20% every 2-3 days if performing well
learning.when_to_pause: Consider pausing ads with CTR below 1%, CPA 2x your target, or no conversions in 3+ days
learning.objective_tip: Your campaign objective tells Facebook what action you want users to take. Always select the objective that matches your actual business goal - if you want purchases, choose Sales; if you want leads, choose Leads.
learning.objective_tip_box: Target what you really want the user to do - Facebook optimizes for exactly what you ask for
learning.ads_per_adset_title: How many ads per ad set?
learning.campaign_vs_adset_title: New Campaign vs New Ad Set?
learning.pixel_step_3: Name your pixel and enter your website URL
learning.pixel_step_4: Choose installation method (Partner integration or manual code)
learning.pixel_step_5: Test your pixel is firing correctly using the Pixel Helper browser extension
learning.lead_step_1: Go to Facebook Ads Manager and create a new campaign
learning.lead_step_3: Set up your ad set (budget, audience, placements)
learning.lead_step_4: At the Ad level, select "Instant Form" as your lead method
learning.lead_step_5: Click "Create Form" - add your questions (name, email, phone, custom)
learning.lead_step_6: Set up your thank you screen, then publish your campaign
learning.lead_youtube_query: How To Create Facebook Instant Forms
learning.ads_per_adset_tip: 3-5 ads per ad set is the sweet spot
learning.pixel_intro: A Facebook Pixel tracks actions on your website (purchases, sign-ups, etc.) so Facebook can optimize your ads for conversions.
learning.lead_intro: Lead forms let people submit their contact info directly on Facebook without leaving the app. Great for collecting leads quickly.
learning.higher_intent_tip: Choose "Higher Intent" form type if you want more qualified leads (they have to confirm their info)
learning.mistake_too_many_ads: Too many ads in one ad set dilutes your budget across too many variations
learning.mistake_narrow_targeting: Too narrow targeting (audience under 100k) limits Facebook's optimization
learning.mistake_learning_phase: Changing ads during learning phase resets the optimization process
learning.mistake_no_testing: Not testing creative variations means you might miss better performing options

tips.budget_testing: Start with $10-20/day for testing new audiences
tips.audience_size: Keep audience size 500k-2M for best results
tips.ad_variations: Use 3-5 ad variations to let Facebook find winners
tips.budget_increase: Increase budget by max 20% at a time to avoid resetting the learning phase
tips.pause_criteria: Consider pausing ads with CTR below 1% or no conversions in 3 days

wizard.objective_sales: Best for e-commerce. Tracks purchases via your pixel.
wizard.objective_leads: Collect contact info via forms. Great for services.
wizard.objective_traffic: Drive visitors to your website. Good for awareness.
wizard.objective_engagement: Get likes, comments, shares. Build social proof.
wizard.add_location_hint: Add at least one location to target
wizard.advantage_plus_desc: Let Facebook AI find the best users for you automatically
wizard.custom_audience_desc: Target your saved audiences or lookalikes
wizard.no_audiences: No custom audiences found. Create lookalikes or custom audiences in Facebook Ads Manager first.
wizard.interest_hint: Target users based on their interests, hobbies, and behaviors
wizard.learn_setup: Learn how to set it up
wizard.conversion_optimize_sales: Facebook will optimize for this conversion action
wizard.conversion_optimize_leads: Track when visitors convert on your website
wizard.lead_type_title: Where do you want to collect leads?
wizard.lead_type_desc: Choose where you want to collect leads from your audience
wizard.lead_type_form_desc: Collect leads directly on Facebook without leaving the app
wizard.lead_type_website_desc: Send people to your website landing page
wizard.primary_text_placeholder: The main text above the image...
wizard.headline: Headline
wizard.select_page_first: Please select a Facebook Page in Step 1 first
wizard.lookalike_hint: Smaller % = more similar to source audience
wizard.no_pixel_warning_desc: Without a pixel, Facebook can't track conversions on your website. Your campaign may not optimize effectively.
wizard.setup_pixel_link: Set up your pixel in Events Manager
wizard.language_hint: Target users who speak specific languages. Leave empty for all languages.
wizard.objective_whatsapp: Get people to message you on WhatsApp. Great for customer service.
wizard.objective_calls: Get people to call your business directly. Great for appointments.
wizard.whatsapp_not_connected_desc: To run WhatsApp ads, you need to connect WhatsApp Business to your Facebook Page. This must be done in Facebook Business Settings.
wizard.whatsapp_setup_link: Set up in Facebook Business Settings
wizard.whatsapp_destination_note: Users will message you on WhatsApp when they click the ad
wizard.calls_destination_note: Users will call your business phone number when they click the ad
wizard.setup_check_desc: Let's make sure you have everything set up for the best results
wizard.pixel_found: Pixel found! Select which one to use:
wizard.continue_without_pixel: You can continue without a pixel, but tracking won't work.
wizard.lead_forms_found: {count} lead form(s) found. You can select one in the ad creation step.
wizard.no_lead_forms_desc: You'll need to create a lead form to collect leads. You can create one in the ad creation step, or set one up in Facebook now.
wizard.create_form_later: You can also create a form in the ad creation step.
wizard.whatsapp_connected: WhatsApp Business is connected to your page.
wizard.next_step_location: Next: Choose where to show your ads
wizard.review_desc: Make sure everything looks good before launching
wizard.campaign_starts_paused: Your campaign will start in PAUSED status. You can activate it from the Manage page after reviewing.

wizard_simple.create_form_hint: Create a lead form in Facebook first
wizard_simple.privacy_policy_hint: Required by Facebook for lead forms
wizard_simple.thank_you_hint: Users will see a "Go to website" button after submitting
wizard_simple.form_tip_1: Ask 2-3 qualifying questions to filter out low-quality leads
wizard_simple.form_tip_2: Use 'Higher Intent' form type for more serious leads (they confirm info)
wizard_simple.form_tip_3: Facebook's algorithm learns what good leads look like from your responses
wizard_simple.form_hint_questions: More questions = fewer but higher quality leads
wizard_simple.form_hint_custom: Add questions like 'What's your budget?' to pre-qualify

uploader.what_would_you_like: What would you like to do?
uploader.choose_path_desc: Choose the option that best fits your goal
uploader.create_campaign_desc: Start from scratch with a brand new campaign. Run with optimal Facebook recommended targeting, set your budget, and choose your objectives. Perfect for launching new products or testing new objectives.
uploader.create_when: Choose this when you want a new objective or new targeting
uploader.create_examples: Examples: New product launch, testing a different audience, new marketing goal
uploader.how_to_start: How would you like to start?
uploader.start_fresh_desc: Create a brand new campaign from scratch
uploader.duplicate_existing_desc: Start with settings from a campaign that worked well
uploader.add_creative_desc: Add a new ad variation to a campaign that's already running. Keep the same targeting while testing new creatives. Great for A/B testing.
uploader.add_when: Choose this when you want to test new creatives with the same targeting
uploader.add_examples: Great for A/B testing: same audience, different images or text
uploader.edit_desc: Modify targeting (location, age, budget) on an ad set, or update ad copy, media, and lead forms. Fine-tune your existing campaigns.
uploader.edit_when: Choose this to modify campaigns that are already running
uploader.edit_examples: Change targeting (location, age) or update ad content (text, image, CTA)
uploader.what_to_edit: What would you like to edit?
uploader.edit_targeting_desc: Change locations, age range, and demographics
uploader.edit_creative_desc: Change headline, text, image, video, or CTA button
uploader.select_option_hint: Select an option above to continue
uploader.duplicate_desc: Clone an existing campaign with all its settings and ads
uploader.no_adsets_found: No ad sets found in this campaign

campaigns.reason_no_results: Spending but no results - check targeting

recommendations.title: Recommendations
recommendations.campaign_problem: "{name}" is spending but getting no results
recommendations.campaign_low_ctr: "{name}" has low click rate - try adding new creatives
recommendations.campaign_no_conversions: "{name}" has clicks but no conversions yet

tooltips.spend: Total money spent on ads during this period
tooltips.impressions: How many times your ad was shown to people
tooltips.clicks: How many people clicked on your ad
tooltips.ctr: Click-through rate - % who clicked. Above 1% is good!
tooltips.cpc: Cost per click - how much you pay for each click. Lower is better!
tooltips.conversions: Actions you want: purchases, sign-ups, leads, etc.
tooltips.cpa: Cost per conversion - what you pay for each result. Lower is better!
tooltips.conversion_rate: % of clicks that became conversions. Higher is better!

status_modal.pause_campaign_explanation: Pausing this campaign will stop all ads inside it. Your audience won't see any of these ads until you resume.
status_modal.pause_adset_explanation: Pausing this ad set will stop all ads inside it. Other ad sets in the campaign will continue running.
status_modal.pause_ad_explanation: Pausing this ad will stop showing it to your audience. Other ads in the ad set will continue running.
status_modal.resume_campaign_explanation: Resuming this campaign will start showing your ads again. Make sure your budget is set correctly.
status_modal.resume_adset_explanation: Resuming this ad set will start showing its ads again. The parent campaign must also be active.
status_modal.resume_ad_explanation: Resuming this ad will start showing it again. The parent ad set and campaign must also be active.
status_modal.reassurance: You can change this back anytime - nothing is permanent.
